Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அறனியலான் இல்வாழ்வான் என்பான் பிறனியலாள்பெண்மை நயவா தவன்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: He who desires not the womanhood of her who should walk according to the will of another will be praised as a virtuous house-holder.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A man is shown in his home environment. Before him is an opportunity for an illicit affair with another's wife ('பிறன் இயலாள் பெண்மை').
Layered_Composition.Midground: He is shown actively and decisively turning his back on this temptation ('நயவாதவன்').
Layered_Composition.Background: Because of this act of virtuous refusal, his own domestic life ('இல்வாழ்வான்') is shown to be blessed and founded on virtue. A divine light shines upon his home, and a celestial voice or inscription appears, declaring him a 'virtuous householder' ('அறன் இயலான்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The defining characteristic of a virtuous householder is that he does not desire the wife of another man.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The act of turning away from temptation is the key. His virtue is not passive, but an active choice. The divine blessing on his home is a direct consequence of this choice, showing that domestic virtue is built upon this specific act of self-control.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A pure, virtuous, golden light illuminates the man and his home at the moment he makes the right choice. The temptation is associated with a fleeting, deceptive shadow.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that captures the moment of refusal and the immediate, divine validation of his status as a virtuous householder.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, focusing on his determined and virtuous expression.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: A divine, blessing light that affirms his choice.

Cultural_Anchors: He who does not desire the womanhood of another's wife (பிறன் இயலாள் பெண்மை நயவாதவன்)
